intro: Maytenus octogona, commonly known as the eight-angled mayten, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its distinctive eight-sided stems and dark green,革质 (leathery) leaves that are opposite in arrangement. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Maytenus octogona is valued for its hardy nature and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
